overview: Jaipur, the capital of Rajasthan and known as the Pink City, is a planned 18th‑century city famous for its pink‑hued architecture, forts, palaces and historic monuments. It forms part of India's Golden Triangle and serves as a gateway to desert destinations like Jodhpur and Jaisalmer.
bestTimeToVisit: October to March (cool, dry winter months)
topAttractions: Jal Mahal (Water Palace) – view from the lake
travelTips: Carry bottled water and stay hydrated, especially in summer.
Dress modestly for temple visits (cover shoulders and knees).
Use autorickshaws or app‑based cabs; negotiate fares or insist on meter.
Book entry tickets for major forts and museums online where possible to avoid queues.
Visit popular sites early in the morning to beat crowds and heat.
Carry some cash in INR as small vendors may not accept cards.
Avoid the peak summer months (April–June) due to extreme heat.
Respect local customs and ask permission before photographing people.
